page.title: 06PRE-WAR HOUSES IN BECKLEY
page.content: Most of the houses in the older part of the village are built of stone. Some of them have thatched roofs but many are tiled. Most of these older houses were built before 1800 but since the 1939-45 War many have been joined together to form larger dwellings. Most of them have little or no front gardens but have large back gardens. Climbing roses make many of the cottages very attractive in the summer. Some bungalows were built along the Woodperry Road in the years between the two World Wars. They were constructed of brick. A few made of wood or asbestos have since been clad in brick or rendered. Our survey showed that about 60% of the houses have some double glazing and most of them are heated by oil but coal, wood and electricty are quite popular.
